caption: Delicious pasta

Ordered a cornucopia of selections to go from here for a pasta feast in one night.  Right off the bat, the focaccia and ricotta & honey knocked me clean out of my Bombas socks. The focaccia isn't as oily or airy as other focaccia I've had, but the elation of the softness, heartiness and salty flavor of this thick focaccia is quite pleasing. I was going to heat it up (as the pasta had to travel a far way home) but after one bite I couldn't in good conscience take the time it would require.  On first bite some folks thought the ricotta was burrata because of its pillowy, smooth texture. The combo of that cream with the sweetness of the honey and the big, tender focaccia was honestly my favorite part of the meal.  As a carnivore naturally I ordered the gnocchi with sausage sauce, which could've benefitted from a reheat I think. The gnocchi wasn't as soft as my tongue prefers, but the custom shape was a little chunk of art in each bite.  The spaghetti had a complex, deep umami flavor that was delightfully unexpected. The acidity of tomatoes often punches through during a plate of spaghetti, but it was napping quietly during this dish to our pleasant delight.  Pork ragu tagliatelle was like putting your favorite warm cardigan on while slurping a glass of wine from a bottle you swiped from your rich parent's secret wine cellar. It knew exactly what it was doing and delivered.  The fennel salad delivered a quenching punch of citrus and your nose picked up the garlic before the fork hit your mouth. It was hard not to get a spoon and rescue all the dressing once the salad was gone.
Great hand made pasta, and really nice people working here.

Absolutely stunning little store with a continuous show of Artisans making fresh pasta in all sorts of shapes and textures. Check out their assortment of sauces ready to go in glass jars that pair perfectly with the pastas that you just ordered.  Get hot and ready to eat pasta dishes too!  We paid about $9 a pound for our spaghetti and we will be coming back soon for more! We didn’t like the creamy pork sauce as much, but it provably just wasn’t our favorite flavor- will try the red sauce next time

Amazing food. You can taste the quality ingredients they use, it really makes a difference. I ordered delivery and the quality was still delicious, not to mention that the portion sizes are actually reasonable. Will definitely be making this a regular spot!

I've had handmade pasta at many great restaurants. Nothing compares to the quality and freshness of the pasta and sauces at Tortello. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is also incredible. Almost everytime I've been there the owner is walking around, checking on every table, and making sure everyone is having a pleasant experience. As a hospitality professional for over 10 years I cannot speak highly enough about this wonderful little gem.
The best spaghetti in the city. High quality ingredients and the chefs know their craft! Excellent wine selection too

Simply amazing! I got the meal kit for 2 for Valentine’s Day and it was better than I could ever expect! I have had terrible carry-out luck in the last year with other restaurants but Tortello did not disappoint in the least! It was as if we were eating food fresh from the kitchen of the restaurant... but at home! Would highly recommend for a date night or special occasion!

Easily the best pasta I’ve ever had. Incredible attention to detail here at Tortello. Every food offering is unique and so fresh/delicious. They never cease to impress me even with the most simple Italian dishes. Extraordinarily friendly staff and ownership!

We started with Tortello mealkits; and now it's a full blown addiction. Perfect for date night, a carry-out meal for the family, or al fresco dining when the whether permits. Grazie a mille to Dario & team for always hooking it up.
great homemade pastas. the squid ink bucatini is unreal

Never had dine-in, but I always come here to grab pasta ingredients to make at home.  I'm never disappointed by the service or flavor.  The pasta is dense, so I always have leftovers.  It's expensive, but that's to be expected.  Tortello has been a great addition to Wicker.
One of my favorite date night spots! The outdoor ambiance & yummy pasta transports me back to Italy.

The pasta and and the focaccia were very good, but I wouldn't say they are the best I've had in Chicago. Still, I very much enjoyed them! The tiramisu was incredible, and probably the best I've had here! Portions are a bit small for the price. But given the current climate for restaurants during covid, I didn't mind contributing to a local eatery. Keep up the good work, guys!

(Post is about a week and a half post- experience)  Whoa!!! Found this nugget via my multiple review searches and let me say that it’s a 💎 for sure! After craving cacio e pepe for dayyyss, it was IN-sane!! Like, so insane that after I scarfed down my first helping, I first complemented the chef and then politely ordered a second helping. 😋👌🏼 The servings were fair, perfect. They come in little black rectangular containers with clear tops.  Deets: • super cute inside- narrow and quaint. • they have a cute setup of wines, fresh pastas, sauces  and cheeses to buy to the left of the register and in the cooler beneath the register. Prices vary but reasonable. • the lady working the register was the sweetest and warmest. Kind, patient and helpful from her first word to the order being brought out to me personally. • I was allowed to wait for my order inside with my 😷 on of course. I watched the young lady cut freshly made pasta in the window while jamming to their bomb music. 👌🏼 • I was gifted a free dessert for confusion of info on one of the search sites, and it was yummy as well! It was a chocolate salami.  All in all, Tortello was exactly the vibes and yummy food I needed on a cold winter Chicago day. ⛄️

Can’t indoor dine right now? Don’t worry the Tortello to go will do the trick!! I’m a huge burrata girl but wasn’t as impressed with the burrata tortellini as I thought I would He, but it was still tasty. I should have done no nuts and I recommend splitting with others as it is very rich. However the spaghetti was to die for and everything else I’ve had at Tortello in the past is always amazing. Fresh pasta and fresh ingredients, I also like to buy the farm fresh eggs to bring home, they are the best I have ever had. Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!!

I would expect this place located in Little Italy in Pilsen. The pasta is made fresh and their options are filling, tasty, and of a great variety. The location is relaxing and open. You can view their staff working on your meal or if you have time watch the pasta get made. Not sure who is in charge of pasta prices but this is in line with restaurants in Little Italy.
Fantastico.  Perfect pasta, sauce and other goodies. Great staff.
Delicious fresh homemade pasta! Great for taking home or a casual place to eat in.
Truffle prix fixe menu was super slow.  2.5 hours for 4 courses. And quality was not worth the pricetag.
tortello is my last name :)

Update: we have now eaten outside and regret not doing it earlier! Amazing food, won’t go anywhere else anymore!  Amazing fresh pasta that we buy all the time to prepare at home. Never tried their pasta entrees but it always smells and looks delicious!
The restaurant is superb and spacious, the meals was delightful and the rates were very inexpensive. rapidly, effective service and very welcoming waiters. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
Everything about Tortello is outstanding! The handmade pasta is the star but a close second is the focaccia and ricotta. If you like Negronis, then Darios is a must.

Trigger warning: This perspective is from a vegan person.  For a place that seems to pride itself on ingredients and knowing their food, both times we went the person didn't know what it was to be vegan. This was after I had messaged them confirming they had options beforehand. Even worse, they told us the Panzanella was vegan and the 2nd time we went they said it wasn't. I'm fine with places that don't offer vegan options, but to not even know what it is or be able to answer basic questions about ingredients and allergens seems absurd to me for a place like this.  I truly do love the atmosphere and their live music. It's a shame they aren't suited for those of us with different diets
(Translated by Google) Excellent place you eat divine  (Original) Excelente lugar se come divino

I went for lunch here recently and it was a wonderful experience. The staff were friendly and attentive and the pasta was delicious - each dish was cooked perfectly and made with fresh ingredients (including fresh herbs from their planters located on the perimeter of their patio). My family is from the same region of Italy as the owner and I can say without any hesitation that Tortello makes authentic Italian pasta. It is a charming restaurant with delicious food. Don't forget to order the focaccia with ricotta and honey as an appetizer - it was amazing!

The very best place in Wicker park to get fresh homemade italian pasta, aged Negroni and italian delicacies. Italian, ultra legit owner. Very nice outdoor patio. Anything with a fish based recipe is outstanding. Their cacio and pepe sauce and pasta is also amazing. Insider trick if you have guests, as you can buy the pasta, the sauce and you will be delighted in minutes. A local favorite of a milanese and a Venetian immigrants. Enjoy!
Tortello’s pasta is magical. It is beautifully flavored and completely charming.
Can't go wrong!
Wow! If you want some good homemade pasta this is the place for you. We tried three different pastas but I recommend the tortelli! Such a cute nice place with a patio !!!
We got the ragu meal kit for 2 and the buratta and everything was absolutely delicious! It was fresh, flavorful and authentic. We’ll definitely be back!
This is some of the best pasta I’ve found outside Italy and definitely the best in Chicago. It’s a great find and looking forward to going back!
Great flavors and impeccable service!
Great food
Amazing fresh pasta and bread
Wonderful place! Food is really tasty and portions are perfect. Pasta is fresh with an extraordinary flavor. Excellent service. Definitely adding Tortello to my favorite places 🤩
Best Italian restaurant in Chicago and it’s not even close. Perfect ambiance and portion sizes. My taste buds will be reminiscing about this meal until my next visit.
Food is ok if they gave you enough to fill your belly, would be nice if they had at least served bread with you meal, hope they st least take care of the band, best part of the experience here.
Best pasta in the city by far. Worth every penny.

What is the secret to making great pasta? A great pasta! Often times so much of focus goes to making a great sauce for your pasta that you forget the main ingredient: the pasta!!! This gem of a place in Chicago does just that. Making fresh pasta daily using quality imported semolina flour from Italy, fresh organic eggs from a local farm up in Wisconsin and water. That’s all the ingredients you need and the results are fantastic! In my previous post, I made stop at Tortello just to check out their production. I’m a skeptic like that. I’ve had so many pasta dishes in the US. Many will boast of theirs being authentic but often times I leave disappointed in their quality and in execution. So before trying it out, I decided to make an inspection first. When I walked in, I met  the owner Dario Nonni who greeted me at the door and we had a brief conversation about his place. From what I saw, I was impressed so I decided to come back another day to give this place a try.  Second time around, we went into throw down and ordered the following: Focaccia w/ ricotta & honey, fennel, celery & orange salad, tortelli, cacio e pepe and Zucchini “pasta” w/ grass-fed beef ragú. All the pastas were excellent. Their tortelli  One dish to point out: their cacio e pepe was one of the closest I had outside of Rome and I love how they kept it simple (good bucatini style pasta, imported aged pecorino cheese and fresh pepper) - just like how that dish is suppose to be. Complimenti Dario!  For dessert we got their classic tiramisu. This is the one that I anticipated the most. If you know the history of this dessert, it originated from a town called Treviso, about 30km north of Venezia. Since Dario is from Venice, I expected him to keep the recipe as close to the traditional one as possible. Thankfully he did. Aside from couple of very minor critiques, I can say that their tiramisu is probably the best one I’ve had in Chicago and made/taste the way how Tiramisu is suppose to be! Bravo Cuoco!  I wanted to talk and thank Dario & Jill in person after this wonderful experience. Unfortunately they were not in that day but I was more impressed because of their absence because their staff provided excellent service and the chef also trained his staff to keep the dishes consistent which I found out recently from my other visits to restaurants that it is not an easy task to do. Because of this, Tortello Pasta gets my #kkapproved hashtag. Auguri Tortello e ci vediamo alla prossima!  Disclaimer: I do not have any experience in food & restaurant industry nor have any training in culinary school. My only credential is that I know lot of chefs and I may have had more pasta / Italian food (both locally and all across Italy) than your average Italian.

One of the best restaurants on division street!! The pasta was beyond excellent, from food to service you are treated like family. I will definitely be recommending this place to anyone who wants great pasta and excellent service. Thank you tortello staff for an extraordinary experience 😊
excellent handmade pasta. exciting to see a small business pivot in covid. the tortello is *excellent*!

Tortello is one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. The pasta tasted soooo good. The staff is so friendly and welcoming. Everything was prepared from fresh ingredients, and the quality of the food is outstanding and delicious. The owner gave us dessert on the house, and it was also so good. We will definitely be coming back soon.
Fantastic! One of my regular spots. Everyone working here is great and the food is amazing

Felt very unwelcome from the time I stepped foot in the door, but still gave the place a chance. Person greeting me thought I was picking up food for a delivery company. May be just a sign of the times with all the unrest these days. Other customers were checked on and I wasn’t approach even once for questions about how my experience was. Hubby and I have lived in the neighborhood for over thirty years and we make it our business to frequent establishments on Division St.. Was really looking forward to the experience after we’ve walked past the window with pasta being freshly prepared. Very unfortunate. -Tosh SPARKS
Amazing place ! Genuine authentic Italian dishes . Well done Dario !

Being in quarantine so long really makes me miss Tortello. This place is an escape from the moment you walk in the door. The ambiance takes you away and the food makes you feel like your in Italia!  The simple Focaccia appetizer with ricotta, honey and a touch of olive oil is knee buckling.  The signature dish, The Tortelli, is out of this world. You can taste the effort that was put into the dough, the filling, the sauce, it is meant to be savored. This was crafted people, think about the time that goes into that plate before you get it, you cannot get an experience like this anywhere in Chicago. I have dreams about it.  Finallly, the Tiramisu is delicious and a perfect portion to finish it off. What can I say...can't wait to get out of this quarantine. Fist stop, Tortello, I like to sit by the arm Tattoo on the wall, lol.  Bouna notte...sweet dreams coming my way.
This place isn’t a restaurant, it is an experience. The pasta is like nothing I’ve ever had, and the experience was quite pleasant. Looking forward to going back

One of the best places for pasta in Chicago! Everything is super fresh and authentic, my favorites where the baked duck ragu, the lumache with beef ragu, the burrata tortellinis ,and lobster bucatini.
The pasta is outstanding and the customer service and care is exceptional.
Not up to par with their bathroom policy. I deliver for this restaurant and they refused bathroom entry. CRUEL, RUDE
Much too pricey for the small portion you get.
Friendly, classic dishes beautifully prepared.
I love this place! Amazing food and Dario, the owner, is a real charm.
Loved loved this restaurant.  Everything was awesome.
Authentic for sure! Delicious,  made on the spot, leaves you wanting more😊
The homemade nature of the pasta really comes through. Smaller but appropriate portion sizes. Flavors are incredibly rich, each bite is a joy.

Recommended by our daughter.The prices were high for the portion size.Service was slow and the food came lukewarm.Wine by the glass was small. Taste was good.Overall I was diasappointed.Probably will not return.

Expensive, portion sizes are small, service was mediocre. There is absolutely no reason to pay $22 and up for a small plate of pasta at an order-at-the-counter kind of place.  I think buying the fresh pasta at $9/lb to take home and cook is a better strategy here.
Really wonderful pasta!  I loved both the chuisoni and lasagna. There was a bit of a wait but it was offset by complimentary prosecco.  I'll be back!
Fantastic food and atmosphere, and we loved meeting and chatting with owner Dario. Best tiramisu I've ever had.

Found the bucatini too al dente and salty for my tastes. I wanted the ragu and should have trusted my gut but I prefer the bucatini noodles. The focaccia was good but wish they would have provided just olive oil.  Update- back again to give it a 2nd chance. Second and last time i will go here. Ordered to go and they said it would be 20min and I waited over 55min! The couple in front of me had their food and left before I even got mine. Were they apologetic- yes but still be more realistic on how long id have to wait. I waited 20min just to even order my food. Is it good - sure but there are plenty of other Italian places with homemade pasta in Chicago. Go to them!

It’s an awful business model and the manager is rude as hell. I waited in line when the kitchen closed because it had too many orders, then the manager let his “VIP”s cut the line and screamed at me when I questioned it. Don’t go here if you’re hungry, have standards for good service or want to sit (very tiny, have to order before you sit).

I love the story of Tortello, as the tattoo on the wall is The life story of the owner in his own words. A man who believes in connecting people with love and amazing Italian food that anyone will enjoy. Dine in authenticity at Tortello...

My new favorite restaurant. I walked in alone on a whim, thinking I'd grab a quick lunch after my doctor's appointment. The host made me feel so welcome, and I was thrilled with the food. The spaghetti is literally insane -- stracciatella and bas on top of fresh pasta??? I've been thinking about it ever since.  I'm honestly surprised this place doesn't have a line out the door.  The only thing I would wish for is that they jarred their pasta sauces and provided paper boxes for their pastas. I didn't buy the (delicious) pasta sauce they sell because it's in paper cups, even though I really wanted to. That could easily spill in my bag, even if I wrap it. I also bought their tortelli and it stuck together in the paper bag they gave me. I came home with about half of it ripped, very sad.  Not their fault, just wanted to share a few opportunities for improvement. I'd still return at every opportunity. The food and service is amazing.

Listen, the pasta was amazing but..., the serving sizes were small for $22 worth of pasta. It doesn't have to be America-size big but I shouldn't have to scrounge around my fridge after dinner cause I'm hungry. I'm eating pasta for crying out loud! I think I should be satisfied.

This fresh pasta shop on the busy street of Division is hard to miss and even harder pass up. Whether you’re stopping in for lunch or grabbing some pasta to take home you’re ahead of the curve. The dishes I’ve tried including the pappardelle and bucatini are amazing. The atmosphere is great with lots of natural light showcasing the staff hand-making pasta in the window. Great music and wine selection as well and don’t miss the specials on the wall with large scrabble squares. The food outside of the pasta is a sure order with items like the burrata. Order this while they make your pasta, you won’t regret it. It’s beyond delicious. I took some pasta home and could not be more hooked on this over anything you could find in the grocery store. Così buono!

Came in for the Sagra di Tortello last weekend.  The cacio e pepe is inspired. I could have devoured the whole plate. The tiramisu was also out of this world good.  Absolutely outstanding food, service, and atmosphere. I can’t wait to come back to try their regular menu.
Visited here several times on a trip to Chicago - so so good!  Worth the queue but lunchtime is quieter
Amazing pasta and great service. Big fan.
This place was amazing!! Best pasta in Chicago. I think it was actually even better than when i visited Italy! Can’t wait to go back again. Yummm!!!

What a gem. Having lived in Italy, it's an understatement to say it is very rare to find authentic pasta, prepared perfectly. Tortello has taken handmade pasta to the height of its art form -- true to its roots, yet modern. Here you'll find a warm, inviting atmosphere and a menu to die for. Dario is such a gracious host and I can't wait to return!

Excellent Italian cuisine. Flavor of each dish is so tasty! Highly recommend the tortellini and focaccia bread. Cannot go wrong with any selection. A little pricey but worth the purchase. Service is excellent.
Pretty good. Not a wow

Wow wow wow. We have always enjoyed dinner here - Dario and crew are incredibly talented and warm-hearted, and their pasta is spectacular. But last night we took Tortello’s pasta making class and were blown away by the fun experience. Their head pasta maker, Alex, took us through a passionate short history of pasta, then ably walked us through a hands on experience of making dough, followed by four different pasta shapes. Afterwards, we enjoyed a full dinner of salads, pastas and desserts. But wait, there’s more! Each of us left with a couple bags of the dough and pastas we made. Enough for many more meals. I highly recommend taking the class, especially with a group of friends.
Great, authentic Italian food!
Criminally fresh! Cannot wait to go back!
After living in Italy for many years this place tastes just like it! Thanks for the fresh pasta!
Extremely fresh and flavorful pasta. Prices are high but you pay for quality

I had the Spaghetti with Pomodoro, Straciatella, and basilico. It was such a perfect plate of pasta the entire rest of my day I have been thinking about it, wishing I had at least ordered another serving..I’ll be back to Chicago and I know I will immediately go back to Tortello.
Great place to eat tortellis!!

Amazing pasta, but very pricey. With two drinks and two mains we came out to almost $100. That said, it was worth it despite counter service being a little strange for a place with such well constructed dishes.
Fresh, in house made pasta.  Delicious
You can watch them make the pasta and cook the pasta. What could be better?

My boyfriend and I went a few weeks ago and loved it! The focaccia was amazing and both of our pastas were delicious! Plus great service. Today we got some the pasta to cook at home and even with our cheap Costco brand sauce it was incredible!
Unbelievable!!!...
Excellent pasta, although a little expensive for what it is. The fennel salad wasn't very good. The space is nice, especially seeing the pasta making.

Absolutely do not eat here. For $19 you’ll get approximately 1 cup of pasta that’s tough and sitting in a pool of grease. They also don’t even have a phone number to call if there’s an issue. Definitely not an acceptable meal, let alone a good one.

(Translated by Google) Whether cooking pasta or the finesse of sauces, it breathes Italian in this restaurant. Taste and not invigorating cuisine. To try if you miss Europe.  (Original) Que ce soit la cuisson des pâtes ou la finesse des sauces, ca respire italien dans ce restaurant. Cuisine gustative et non roborative. A essayer si l’europe vous manque.

Definitely stop by this place! We have come here regularly since it opened. The dine-in entrees are great (family friendly) and the take-out homemade pasta has been a gamechanger for our homecooking. The quality of the pasta is a level above anything else you can buy in the area. An added plus is that the owner / staff are super friendly and make it feel like a true neighborhood spot.  Under appreciated attribute: the wine / canned good section flies under the radar but is fantastic.
Great pasta!

The owner is always there and willing to talk. Everything is fresh and made authentically as in litterally the pasta. You can watch it being prepared. I do not like Italian places but this place I go to. Its the only one I actually crave.
The food is amazing and Dario is great!
This restaurant is totally awesome. All the pasta is fresh, including the bucatini, may favorite.
The food is amazing and the staff is so welcoming. Love this place!
Loved the food! Had the focaccia and ricotta, fennel salad, gnocchi w oxtail, and burrata torteli. Casual vibe and high quality food is my favorite combo.
(Translated by Google) Delicious pasta, pleasant atmosphere, kind service  (Original) Massas deliciosas, ambiente agradável, atendimento gentil
Loved my experience here...excellent food, staff, and space!! I will definitely be going back!!!
This restaurant truly sets the standard on how pasta should be made and served.  This is authentic Italian cuisine at it's best.  Complimenti a Dario!! Non vedo l'ora di ritornare!

Finally a great place for pasta in Chicago. Lumache and Chiusoni, perfectly cooked pasta, with perfectly matched sauces with high quality ingredients. Nice selection of tasty wines. As I write this, my mouth is watering... it's that good.

I had the Chiusoni and shared an order of the focaccia with honey and riccota. The Chiusoni was pretty flavorful; I was a fan of the pasta itself, and the sausage was tender and appropriately salty - a pretty hearty dish. Only downside was that the pasta itself was just a touch undercooked, in my opinion. The focaccia was decent, nothing crazy special, and the riccota and honey was a nice, if not unique touch! What really killed it for me was the super high price and TINY portion. I don't mind the counter-serve style, and minimal atmosphere, but the amount of pasta on the plate was smaller than my hand... I made the joke to my friends that we should schlep over to Popeye's after for a 4-piece. The combination of quite-high price, decent pasta, and teeny serving brings this joint down a bit from an ace rating.

Been hearing the hype on Tortello and this place lives up to it. The overall aesthetic is extremely pleasing - fresh pasta made and cut in the window, Vespa hanging from the ceiling, trays of pastas just waiting to be devoured.  The staff is extremely helpful and attentive for a casual place.  They walked us all through the different menu items and explained the origins of the dishes.  We went with the tortelli, chuisoni, and bucatini.  All were excellent with the tortelli being my favorite.  It’s hard to find excellent fresh pasta and this place nails it.  Can’t wait to return to try the lamache and some espresso!
Delicious fresh pasta with perfectly paired sauce.  Authentically Italian, great lively atmosphere.
Beautiful decorated with a pleasant atmosphere to talk during your meal. The first courses were so good.
Delicious. Excellent Customer service
Excellent quality. Dine in was a bit pricey, but worth it. Will be back.
Warm, friendly, quick service; clean venue with pleasing display of pasta being made by hand. Great selection of pastas and sauces for dining in house or to bring home. I will definitely go back!

Special salads, Tortelli, Agnolotti, Bucatini, Zucchini, Lumache, Parmigiano & Balsamic, Burrata & Tomatoes. Will mention that their air conditioning felt a little underpowered on a very humid and rainy day. BYOB $10 corkage.

I work in the neighborhood and I love having a place like this to dine in for lunch. The atmosphere of the space draws you in and welcomes you immediately (pasta making in the window is fantastic!). The owner and staff are very kind and I feel like I'm making a little escape to Italy any time I pop in. I've also taken away pasta to make at home and my dinner guests couldn't have loved it more. A gem of a restaurant for Chicago.
Amazing pasta!
Delicious!

I’ve been dying to try this restaurant ever since I heard the concept. They didn’t disappoint. Our dinner was fantastic. We tried four appetizers and three pasta dishes. Everything was excellent, including the staff. Watching the pasta being made brought back great memories. I’ll definitely be back!

Who doesn’t love handmade pasta made with love? Top pasta is the chiusoni (saffron, sausage, onions, and cream) and the bottom photo is the lumache (natural grass fed beef rage). The pastas are a little on the price side like $17-$19 each dish but it is well worth every single bite!
Absolutely amazing. If I'm ever in Chicago again I would go out of my way to go back here.
Amazing fresh pasta, antipasto, and friendly service
Great handmade pastas! Owner was super friendly and gave us recos on what to order. House red wine was great! A little pricey but worth it for fresh handmade pastas!
Loved the homemade pasta and the nice variety of drinks. There are only cold desserts but I would just focus on the pasta. Get the bread as appetizer!

Way over priced! I requested my capelli to be cooked a little more, I do not like aldenti, they did not comply. The pasta was very hard!  The mushroom sauce was very good but it was to salty. I think it was BC of the extra parmesan cheese I asked for, it was domestic and salty, for those prices they should serve imported.
We just love bringing our whole family here.  Just brings a smile to our kids face watching the pasta be made!   We have loved every dish!

Being Italian myself I had high expectations going into the restaurant. Everything was delicious, especially tortelli all burrata e lumache al ragù. Excellent desserts as well and a big  choice of Italian wines. Dario, the owner, is an amazing, authentic person who puts a lot of passion in his business. Service was great too! Would recommend for sure!
Food was delicious and being able to see the pasta made was great as well. The portion sizes could be more though, given the price.
Best Italian food I ever had! Definitely going there on my next visit to Chicago 😀 Owner is really nice and friendly and I am pretty sure they will need a bigger place soon!
Fresh pasta and quality ingredients - can't go wrong with any dish! 👌🏼
Amazing highly recommend..

My husband and I came here looking forward to trying the pasta. The options on the menu aren't many but we tried two different dishes and enjoyed both of them. The texture of the pasta reminded me much more of dried pasta than fresh pasta, as fresh pasta is usually softer and the pasta in the dishes was rather chewy. You place your order at the register, pay, tip, and then sit down. We sat down in a nirmal fashion, across from each other at a table, until we realized that the HVAC was leaking on all of the seats. There were no notes deterring anyone from sitting over there so I let management know, but they were already well aware, just didn't think it necessary to tell any guests, or clean up the dripping water, or try to do anything to stop the dripping-- the owner just shrugged and said that there was nothing they could do. We ate our food after waiting longer than I thought was reasonable considering the number of people in the restaurant, and sat back to await the granitas I had ordered. Again, after waiting longer than we should have a server came to our table to set one orange granita down and said we only had one orange left so here's a chocolate one to replace the other one. We were not asked if we wanted a replacement, we were not offered any options, they just assumed that we would want the half-frozen chocolate granita to replace the orange one I had already paid for. I tried a little and noticed it had a strong coffee taste--this was at 9pm, not the time one would generally be drinking coffee--and neither I nor my husband drink coffee anyway and I can't have caffeine due to health concerns, so that one was left mostly untouched. As we were about to leave I asked if there was coffee in the one they decided to substitute without asking us about it, and another worker confirmed that there was. I suggested to her that something like that should be mentioned before serving it to someone, especially when they didn't order it. So even though we liked the pasta well enough, the general failure in customer service would prevent us from returning to spend that much money again.
Amazing fresh made pasta!
Excellent food simple but impressive menu great atmosphere
The owner Darío was very super friendly and attentive. He helped us celebrate in the best way possible. Food was fresh and delicious, and the experience is a must in Chicago.
AMAZING!! Incredibly personal service and the pasta is unlike any other.

Had high expectations going into the restaurant. It was quite amazing to see them prepare the pasta from scratch. The broccoli appetizer we had was very flavorful. However the pasta we had was a little disappointing, not worth the high price tag paid for it.

Perfect pasta!  Can’t say enough good things about this place!  Family friendly and wonderful space for indoor and outdoor seating. Love the view of the kitchen and they make pasta in the front window.  Perfect for date night and for pasta to go.  Totally hip and has a great vibe.
Truly authentic, wonderfully delicious.  I even bought some of their pasta to cook at home.

Cute little spot but the food is what you’re there for. And it is spectacular Italian food. Sure it’s a little pricey but for the quality it feels like you’re getting a deal. I went yesterday and I’ll be back again today, lucky for me I live around the corner

Fantastic! They are brand new and still figuring a few things out so be patient. The bucatini is amazing. Fresh tomato sauce and big pieces of lobster. The homemade pasta is cooked to perfection. The tortelli is the best dish on the menu. The fluffy burrata with the butter and sage melts in your mouth. Focaccia bread and olives are a great appetizer.  Try and few dishes with a bottle of their house wine and you’ll be very happy.

Some of the best and most Italian authentic food in the country. Would definitely recommend to anyone. The service is also amazing, to the owner and all of the staff. They treat you as people not just a customer. They have only provided joy to me and my family. Desperately waiting to attend again. (The Ragu is spectacular)!

What a delightful dinner outside.  Everything was delicious, especially the Tortellini.  But perhaps, the best part is to be greeted by Dario, the owner,, and to experience just a moment of his enthusiasm and passion for his business.
Very good fresh pasta, if they are busy food takes a little bit to be served, but worth the wait

Passed by this place a few times now and the pasta-making in the window always makes us stop. Finally got to try it that day and it was pretty great. I had the Capelli which was delicious! My friend tried the Chiusone which was alos pretty good but I think the Capelli was better 😂 We gave in at the end and got a tiramisu as well which was nice actually. The owner was very friendly with us and all of the other customers too

Hands down the best Italian place to open in Chicago since Osteria Langhe. The dishes seem simple but taste anything but. Counter service, but Dario and crew will take great care of your, or buy the pasta to cook at home. Both are awesome.

This place is wonderful! From the simple pastas my kids ate (which were just butter and cheese but somehow divine!) to the others we had - the tortelli were amazing and I especially loved the chiusone - Tortello really was some of the best pasta I’ve ever had. The chiusone was such an interesting combination of flavors both sweet and aromatic. And of course the owner, Dario, is such a treat! He showed us around and had a story for every bit of the restaurant. Love!

Outstanding.  Excellent pasta and sauces, the best in Chicago IMO.  Tortello returns to the basics - great ingredients and simple recipes - the perfection of Italian cooking.  I highly recommend if you love simple, wonderful Italian pasta.
Wonderful fresh pasta and sauces. I only had take away, but will definitely be back to try some of the freshly cooked dishes as well.
Great Food
Amazing pasta and the owner personally stopped at our table to make sure everything was good. Would highly recommend

The chiusone was the best textured and savoury pasta Ive had in my life, I wanted to lick the plate after. The owner seemed to share the same passion for his dish when he came to ask us how it was, would recommend for sure 👌

Best pasta in the city, it’s homemade right in front of your face, the sauces are to die for, Will definitely be a regular, Ive never had “real” pasta before, amazing!!! Try it!! Also, best ricotta ever!!

Wow wath a place. Just got back from DARIO Home town of Portogruaro after spendingtwo month's inthe beautiful town today I wisited Tortello and guess what I'm  back in Portogruaro but first of all my best wishes to Dario and Jill on the new born Rocco so Romeo have a Brother congratulations Nereo

I’m so excited to have an authentic Italian experience in the heart of Wicker Park! The design and feel of the place was top notch. We lucked out and there was focaccia with ricotta and honey on special the day we walked in. 😍Couldn’t help ourselves to order some, as well as some Rosè. Love the short wine glasses, makes me think of my time in Europe!  Just ate the pasta we bought for home, with the red sauce. 👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻  Can’t wait to come back and enjoy the patio!
The tortelli is amazing—so perfectly al dente I might have teared up. Give me an Aperol spritz and I’m set! I will be back for my third time very soon.

This place is fantastic. The pasta is unbelievable. They source food directly from Italy and use traditional recipes and techniques along with fresh ingredients. Dario, the owner is so fantastic and really cares about what he does.

Pricy place for pasta, but you pay for quality of food. So delicious!!!! Delicioso!!! And excellent customer service for the two guys that runs the place. My only issue two issues were getting a prosseco on a kind of shot glass and my pasta was a bit undercooked.  😢😢😢. Overall good place if you don’t mind to spent $$ on pasta.  Thanks for your reply to my review. I have been in Europe a couple times( including  Italy-Veneto) and it isn’t set in stone about the 5oz. I ‘ve had glasses of wine and prosseco bigger than 5oz, it’s the restaurant discretion what they want to serve to the customers. Said that, I totally come back for the yummy pasta and I would rather buy one of your bottles of wine over a single small glass of prosseco.
ABSOLUTELY amazing!  And the owner is so personable and welcoming.  We're going back this Friday already!  Good luck with the baby guys!  I think it was today you were getting blessed?!?!
Delicious food and hospitable folks. So glad they’re in the neighborhood!
Amazing handmade pasta.  Lovely patio as well when the weather is permitting.  Will definitely be coming back in a regular basis!

AMAZING! The setting and people were so warm and inviting and I was welcomed immediately upon arrival. The beautiful pasta (that you can watch being made in the front window) is SO DELICIOUS. I cannot wait to come back and try the rest of the menu. Grazie!

An awesome restaurant concept with even more incredible food. Literally felt like I was transported to Italy with Tortello’s beautiful ambiance and welcoming atmosphere. It’s clear from every meticulous detail on the menu and in the space that Jill and Dario are deeply committed to their vision of creating a wonderful experience for their patrons. Highly recommend eating on the patio so you’re able to watch the sfoglina hand make the pasta as you wait for your food - it’s actually mesmerizing.  Looking forward to many more dining experiences here and hopeful Tortello will open other Chicago locations in the future!

It’s time that I learn the Italian word for “spectacular.” We went for the pasta and spritz & stayed for the inviting atmosphere. I apologize that my picture has a few bites missing. We dove right in, and after a couple delicious mouthfuls of perfectly cooked al dente pasta, I thought to snap a photo. It’s clear that the owner, Dario, has poured his heart and soul into the creation and operation of this restaurant. Every detail is designed with love and thoughtfulness, especially the station in the window where the incredibly talented sfoglina makes the pasta by hand. We can’t wait to go back!
Great authentic homemade pasta. Great service.
Loved lunch here! The food was fresh and delicious and the place has a great vibe.

We cannot wait to go back! Without a doubt, this was the best pasta we have had in the city. My fiancée and I dined this evening and split three pasta dishes (we couldn’t narrow our selection to two!). We had the tortelli (which is filled with a light, yet creamy burrata, topped with a delicate brown butter sauce, and is balanced by a crunch of crispy sage and toasted hazelnuts), orecchiette (which is tossed in a peppery rapini pesto and breadcrumbs for great textural balance), and lobster bucatini (with super fresh tomatoes that brought a lovely brightness to the dish).  Most notably, the pasta was cooked to a PERFECT al dente, yielding an actual bite that was firm, allowing the pasta to hold its shape, promoting true tasting of the richness of the fresh pasta, and perfectly balancing the texture with the additional components of each dish. There is nothing worse than mushy over cooked pasta. That certainly is NOT the experience here, as Tortello perfected each plate!  The service and atmosphere of Tortello are also wonderful. The owner greeted us as we walked in, spoke to all of the guests at their tables, and showed genuine consideration for each diner and their experience. His passion was obvious and he made my fiancée and I feel welcome right away. There was a mix of families with young children and young and old couples, sitting inside and also dining outside on the patio. While we dined, we noticed the sfoglina making pasta by hand was catching the attention of dozens of passerby on the street. We don’t blame them as we also took the time to sit and watch her!  What a wonderful experience. Tortello has two new regulars. Our only qualm was that we hadn’t visited sooner!

My wife and I eat out several nights a week. So we’re always looking for someplace new and interesting. And Tortello’s is a find. We felt like we were back in Italy. The food was delicious. The pasta was prepared the way we like it. Al dente. With enough simple ingredients to add wonderful textures and flavors to the plate. The owner proudly introduced himself to us and we immediately felt like we were at a family dinner. The design is very clean, comfortable and modern. There’s even a vintage Vespa hanging from the ceiling. We’ll be back often.
Best pasta I've ever had in town! Just delicious. Dario, the owner, and his team make you feel like in an authentic Italian restaurant. Definitely recommended!
Thank you Dario for sharing your dream with us. It was delicious and the perfect place to hang with my fellas.
Lobster was overcooked as it was chewy and rubber like. Pasta was undercooked. Sauce was good. Flavor of pasta would have probably been good if cooked right. Price was on the higher end.
We will be back really fresh and great concepts

Wow!  Amazing food.  We have all had homemade pasta.  But how often do you get artisanal HAND made pasta.  The best I’ve had in the city.  Every dish (my table tried 3) were amazing, but the Tortello di Burrata was one of the best bites of food you’ll find anywhere.  It was one of those bites where my wife and I looked at each other with eyes wide open.  We took our three young boys there too and it was extremely family friendly.   We literally may come back just for that Tortello dish.  Wow!  (SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT TOO! The owner greeted us at the door)

Went for a late lunch. The owner was there greeting everyone that walked in and explaining the concept. Really shows he cares. The best marinated olives!! Lobster spaghetti and mushroom cappelli were delicious! Decent sized portions. Excited to go back and try more!
